result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Dirken J. Harris Jr.
Current: 724 Ridgeland Ave, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2017)
Prior: 725 Gilbert Street #17, Wausau, WI 54403

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CM1448, 15CF397, 15CM404, 15CM490 called: 1:36pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed.

State moves to:
14CM1448>>D&RI entire file
15CM404>>D&RI entire file
15CM490>>D&RI entire file
15CF397 - Ct. 2 (Intimidate Victim/DA/Repeater)>>D&RI
15CF397 - Ct. 3 (Misd BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI
15CF397 - Ct. 4 (Misd BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF397 - Ct. 1 (DC/Domestic Abuse Repeater/DA/Repeater)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 18 months probation.
CONDITIONS: SAFE program intake and any follow up recommended; AODA; Absolute sobriety from alcohol; CC including one domestic abuse surcharge; DNA sample and surcharge; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not do so, defendant must perform 10 hours community service per week; No contact w/victim B.T. unless as approved by PO.

>>In the event of any revocation, defendant entitled to 33 days of time already served.

Adj: 1:47pm
PTC on 7/20/15 at 10:30am - moved. left no address

AMENDED - Includes 14CM1448, 15CF397, 15CM404 and 15CM490.    No contact with victim(s):  B.T. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.

Case Called: 10:52 am

Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in custody and with Atty Kat Jackan.
Date and time set for Defendant's Motion for Bond modification.
Atty Jackan gives argument and requests the Cash Bond to be modified to a Signature Bond. 
State gives argument and would object to any bond modification. 
COURT ORDERS: COURT GRANTS MOTION AND Modifies Cash Bond to a $5,000 Signature Bond to cover all cases. CONDITIONS OF BOND: Non waivable no contact with Victim, No bars, liquor stores, or taverns. 
Adj: 10:56 am

Notice of Motion and Defense Motion for Modification of Bond - stj
